critical_issues: Page 243: Latin fable text heavily corrupted - impacts authenticity of quoted historical source
Page 257: Greek philosophical citations extensively corrupted - affects credibility of primary source references
summary.notes: This batch shows particular vulnerability to non-Latin scripts (Greek, Latin in English translation). Pages with classical language quotations (243, 257) are especially problematic for RAG pipelines as they contain canonical philosophical text. English prose sections perform adequately (GOOD/MARGINAL), but specialized content with footnotes and script mixing causes degradation.
